channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HTTPCLIENT-2105] HttpClient5 makes post call with no body after 307 redirect
item.description:
I have switched from the Apache HttpAsyncClient 4 (4.1.4) library to the httpClient 5 (5.0.1)

I have found that when I make a POST call with body and get back a 307, the subsequent call does NOT include the data body any more, but it does still contain the Content-Type and Content-Length so the server then hangs waiting to receive the rest of the request which never comes.

 
I do not see anything like this while debugging in the HttpClient5 libs

FROM: org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRedirectStrategy

    public HttpUriRequest getRedirect(HttpRequest request, HttpResponse response, HttpContext context) throws ProtocolException {
        URI uri = this.getLocationURI(request, response, context);
        String method = request.getRequestLine().getMethod();
        if (method.equalsIgnoreCase("HEAD")) {
            return new HttpHead(uri);
        } else if (method.equalsIgnoreCase("GET")) {
            return new HttpGet(uri);
        } else {
            int status = response.getStatusLine().getStatusCode();
            return (HttpUriRequest)(status != 307 && status != 308 ? new HttpGet(uri) : RequestBuilder.copy(request).setUri(uri).build());
        }
    }

Here is an example from my logs

>> POST /ws/v3/batch HTTP/1.1
>> User-Agent: Apache-HttpAsyncClient/5.0.1 (Java/11.0.7)
>> Content-Length: 1043
>> Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
>> Host: ORIGINAL_HOST:4443
>> Connection: keep-alive
2020-08-05T20:52:24,377Z DEBUG [httpclient-dispatch-1][HttpAsyncMainClientExec:97] - ex-00000001: produce request data
2020-08-05T20:52:24,378Z DEBUG [httpclient-dispatch-1][HttpAsyncMainClientExec:109] - ex-00000001: produce request data, len 1043 bytes
2020-08-05T20:52:24,379Z DEBUG [httpclient-dispatch-1][HttpAsyncMainClientExec:117] - ex-00000001: end of request data

<< HTTP/1.1 307 Temporary Redirect
<< Cache-Control: max-age=300
<< Location: https://NEW_HOST:4443/ws/v3/batch
<< X-Server-Response-Time: 40ms
<< X-Server-Chain: ORIGINAL_HOST
<< X-Server-Timestamp: Wed, 05 Aug 2020 20:52:24 GMT
<< Content-Length: 0

>> POST /ws/v3/batch HTTP/1.1
>> User-Agent: Apache-HttpAsyncClient/5.0.1 (Java/11.0.7)
>> Content-Length: 1043
>> Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
>> Host: NEW_HOST:4443
>> Connection: keep-alive
2020-08-05T20:52:24,722Z DEBUG [httpclient-dispatch-2][HttpAsyncMainClientExec:97] - ex-00000001: produce request data
2020-08-05T20:52:24,722Z DEBUG [httpclient-dispatch-2][HttpAsyncMainClientExec:117] - ex-00000001: end of request data
item.summary: HttpClient5 makes post call with no body after 307 redirect

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I am using the SimpleHttpRequest, so it is a SimpleBody

SimpleHttpRequest request = SimpleHttpRequests.post(uri);
request.setBody(getJsonBody(), ContentType.APPLICATION_JSON);

randymo Could you please provide a complete wire / context log of the session exhibiting the problem?

Oleg

Sure olegk, I wrote a small mock server on my localhost that would 307 redirect me to the httpbin post api, and this does work if I call the httpbin post api directly instead of after the redirect

try (CloseableHttpAsyncClient client = HttpAsyncClients.createDefault()) {
                client.start();

                URI uri = new URIBuilder()
                        .setScheme("http")
                        .setHost("localhost")
                        .setPort(4080)
                        .setPath("post")
                        .build();

                SimpleHttpRequest request = SimpleHttpRequests.post(uri);

                request.setBody("{\"foo\": \"bar\"}", ContentType.APPLICATION_JSON);

                SimpleHttpResponse response = client.execute(request, null).get(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS);

                LOGGER.info(response.getCode());
                for (Header header : response.getHeaders()) {
                    LOGGER.info(header);
                }
                LOGGER.info(response.getBodyText());
            }
        } catch (Exception ex) {
            LOGGER.error("fail", ex);
        }

 here is the wire logs from that

2020-08-06T17:53:25,973Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 >> "POST /post HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:25,981Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 >> "User-Agent: Apache-HttpAsyncClient/5.0.1 (Java/11.0.7)[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:25,982Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 >> "Content-Length: 14[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:25,982Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 >> "Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:25,982Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 >> "Host: localhost:4080[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:25,982Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 >> "Connection: keep-alive[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:25,982Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 >> "[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:25,983Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:106] - c-00000000 >> "{"foo": "bar"}"


2020-08-06T17:53:26,001Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 << "HTTP/1.1 307 Temporary Redirect[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,001Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 << "Location: http://httpbin.org:80/post[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,002Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 << "connection: keep-alive[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,002Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 << "content-length: 0[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,002Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000000 << "[\r][\n]"


2020-08-06T17:53:26,100Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000001 >> "POST /post HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,101Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000001 >> "User-Agent: Apache-HttpAsyncClient/5.0.1 (Java/11.0.7)[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,101Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000001 >> "Content-Length: 14[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,101Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000001 >> "Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,101Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000001 >> "Host: httpbin.org:80[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,101Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000001 >> "Connection: keep-alive[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:26,101Z [org.apache.hc.client5.http.wire:92] - c-00000001 >> "[\r][\n]"
2020-08-06T17:53:35,944Z [HttpClient5Test:72] - fail
org.apache.hc.core5.util.TimeoutValueException: Timeout deadline: 10000 MILLISECONDS, actual: 10002 MILLISECONDS

It seems the issue could be in the AsyncRedirectExec where the new state.currentRequest does not get the original entity, which does happen in the "classic" RedirectExec. It does still have the AsyncEntityProducer, but I have not been able to find where that gets used in the flow to get the actual entity body.

classic: https://github.com/apache/httpcomponents-client/blob/master/httpclient5/src/main/java/org/apache/hc/client5/http/impl/classic/RedirectExec.java#L158-L159

async: https://github.com/apache/httpcomponents-client/blob/master/httpclient5/src/main/java/org/apache/hc/client5/http/impl/async/AsyncRedirectExec.java#L157

The classic uses the ClassicHttpRequest which extends HttpEntityContainer so it has the getEntity and setEntity methods while the async uses the BasicHttpRequest which does not have those have those methods.

I did try this hack solution, but it failed. 

 if (state.currentRequest == null) {
                        if (SimpleHttpRequest.class.equals(scope.originalRequest.getClass())) {
                            final SimpleHttpRequest simpleHttpRequest = SimpleHttpRequests.create(request.getMethod(), redirectUri);
                            simpleHttpRequest.setBody(((SimpleHttpRequest) scope.originalRequest).getBody());
                            state.currentRequest = simpleHttpRequest;
                        } else {
                            state.currentRequest = new BasicHttpRequest(request.getMethod(), redirectUri);
                        }
                    }

 The state.currentRequest was being set as a SimpleHttpRequest with the correct body, but it still was not actually sending it. Not sure what else I am missing, but hopefully this info is useful for you figuring out what is going on.

randymo I will look into it.

Oleg

There is nothing wrong with the redirect logic. The problem is caused by incorrect implementation of AsyncEntityProducer#isRepetable contract by StringAsyncEntityProducer and BasicAsyncEntityProducer.

Oleg

Please disregard my previous statement. It is wrong. The culprit is indeed the AsyncRedirectExec that fails to reset the entity producer upon redirect of entity enclosing requests.

randymo  Please review the proposed fix:

https://github.com/ok2c/httpcomponents-client/commit/8f2c498c1808953e2a1b7f40b564be50b00d778c

Oleg
Thanks olegk, I can confirm that this change has fixed the issue for me and the POST call after the 307 did in fact send the original payload over the wire now!

Commit f6da2bac6fc891db4f7da9af9158068f3dc87e3d in httpcomponents-client's branch refs/heads/master from Oleg Kalnichevski
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=httpcomponents-client.git;h=f6da2ba ]

HTTPCLIENT-2105: async clients incorrectly handle redirects of requests with enclosed entity

Commit f6da2bac6fc891db4f7da9af9158068f3dc87e3d in httpcomponents-client's branch refs/heads/5.1.x from Oleg Kalnichevski
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=httpcomponents-client.git;h=f6da2ba ]

HTTPCLIENT-2105: async clients incorrectly handle redirects of requests with enclosed entity
olegk is there an eta for when a version with this fix will be released?
